page.title: 08Grafham Church today.
page.content: {Grafham Church}has a nave and two aisles. The{glass}in the leaded windows is coloured light green. The floor in the nave is brick. The congregation sit in 22 pews. There are both oil and electric lights: the heating is by Calor gas. The Lady chapel, in the south aisle, has three statues and is used as a children's corner. There are three {bells}in the steeple . The{organ}has two manuals with six great stops, five swell stops and one pedal stop. There is also a harmonium. The wooden altar rail is supported by painted wrought iron. There are four wooden candlesticks in the sanctuary. The{pulpit}and{lectern}are also wooden, but the{font}is limestone lined with lead. There are three regular{services}a month and{Sunday school}twice a month.
